intro: Otostegia modesta var. modesta, commonly known as the small-flowered otostegia, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the summer months. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes.
